hackathon-description-text: HackSmith 2017 is Smith College’s third annual hackathon. It is currently one of the only college hackathons designed to promote gender equality in computer science. Last year, Hack@Smith 2016 hosted over a 100 students from a diverse range of colleges including Amherst, Brown, Columbia, Rutgers, University of Maryland, College Park, Wellesley, and more. Over 70% of the attendees identified as female.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Assistant Professor of Computer Science @Smith College
Visiting Assistant Professor of Statistical & Data Sciences @Smith College

Bluetooth Headphones for each team member!
Chromecast & fitness trackers for every team member!
$300 for the most innovative business idea, sponsored by the Conway Innovation & Entrepreneurship Center. $100 for the runner-up!

Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Amazon Web Services
